title: How to Teach a Budgie to Catch Flies

steps.headline: Start training.
steps.description: Try a bead on a string. Sunflower seeds work well too. Just wave the bead/food around your budgie and they will try to catch it. When they do, give it a treat.

steps.headline: Practice.
steps.description: Don't expect the bird to catch a fly right away! Just try using food or the bead!

steps.headline: Introduce the fly.
steps.description: When your budgie starts getting good, get a dead fly. Don't give them a big one, give them one they can eat. A house fly would be ideal. .

steps.headline: Set them on a live fly.
steps.description: If their wings aren't clipped, that is a good thing as they will chase it around. If they have been clipped, they will just walk around chasing it.

steps.headline: Reward your budgie.
steps.description: When they made a catch, give them a treat. Seed works well, but they will eat the fly.
